title: Student-Led Science Curriculum Design Project for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Science Knowledge and Experience with Digital Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Students assume roles as scientists/researchers and novice instructional designers, critically analyzing digital educational environments through virtual classroom design experiences using two LMS platforms (MoodleCloud/Google Classroom).

learning_goals: Students can systematically analyze the strengths and weaknesses of platforms by comparing core LMS features (customization, collaboration tools, assessment systems).

Within 5 months, learner groups design science lesson plans based on 3+ themes (e.g., ecosystems, energy transition, space exploration) following science curriculum guidelines. Each lesson plan explicitly links 2 measurable learning objectives (e.g., "Explain photosynthesis in 3 steps") and 1 assessment method (e.g., lab report or quiz) in an instructional design portfolio.
Students provide feedback on peersâ€™ curriculum designs through peer review and submit improved instructional design proposals incorporating the feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
